data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the state of Yucatán, Mexico need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Yucatán, Mexico
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 184,619 believers in Yucatán to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.

data.section_summary: On average, 3 babies will be born in the next hour to families who might know about God culturally, but likely have no relationship with Jesus in Yucatán, Mexico.
data.prayer: Jesus, make yourself real to these new families.
Spirit, please convict each believer in Yucatán, Mexico to take up their calling as a priesthood of believers and pray for the 1,577,181 lost around them.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood

data.prayer: Jesus, you said you were the giver of evangelists to the church. Please, send more evangelists to the state of Yucatán, Mexico.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Japanese people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Japanese people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Japanese people is yours.
Good Shepherd, thank you that you know the name of each of the 184,619 believers in Yucatán.
data.verse: I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me

data.prayer: Lord, the the state of Yucatán will disappear one day, but your Word will never disappear. Call all who claim Christianity to anchor their lives on your Word.
data.verse: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never disappear.

data.prayer: Father, help your children in Yucatán, Mexico find someone like the Samaritan Woman today. Someone who will open an entire town to your message of salvation.
data.verse: So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people, 29 “Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?” They went out of the town and were coming to him.

location.name: Yucatán
location.people_groups_list: Huichol, Jew, Spanish-speaking, Arab, Palestinian, Nahuatl, Eastern Durango, Han Chinese, Cantonese
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Huichol (51,000), Jew, Spanish-speaking (40,000), Arab, Palestinian (13,000), Nahuatl, Eastern Durango (400), Han Chinese, Cantonese (26,000)
